DataElement.preferredName: Prior Investigational Therapeutic Procedure Administered Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no/not applicable coded response regarding whether prior investigational therapies were administered.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the prior investigational therapies being administered.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:In the process of being studied; experimental.  (NCI):An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: In the process of being studied; experimental.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior biologics or immunotherapy within 28 days (or during) of romidepsin administration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Has the patient received any
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient received any other investigational drugs?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received any other investigational drugs within 28 days (or five half-lives, whichever is shorter; with a minimum of 14 days from the last dose) preceding the first dose of trametinib and during the study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient received any other investigational agents or participated in an investigational trial within the past 4 weeks?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient received any other investigational agent within 3 weeks prior to initiation of study therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received other investigational drugs within 2 weeks or 5 half-lives (whichever is longer) prior to study enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had use of an investigation drug or beta adrenergic blockers, including metoprolol, sotalol, within 30 days of enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient received any other investigational agents within the past 4 weeks?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received any investigational agents (except ibrutinib) within 4 weeks prior to beginning treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has received oral targeted agents, have at least 4 half-lives of the agent have elapsed prior to initiation of study therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has received oral targeted agents, have at least 4 half-lives of the agent elapsed prior to initiation of study therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 13
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received investigational drug or immunotherapy (e.g. rituximab) less than or equal to 4 weeks prior to entering the study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was last dose of any investigational agent at least 4 weeks prior to enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was last dose of any investigational agent at least 30 days prior to enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received any other investigational agents within 4 weeks prior to cycle 1, day 1 (or within 5 half-lives if the investigational product, whichever is longer)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 17
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received investigational therapy or any ancillary therapy considered investigational (utilized for a non-FDA approved indication and in the context of a research investigation) less than or equal to 4 weeks prior to registration (patients with prostate cancer are permitted to continue hormone therapy)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 16
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received any other investigational drugs within 28 days (or five half-lives, whichever is shorter; with a minimum of 14 days from the last dose) preceding the first dose of trametinib and during the study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 14
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received any other experimental drug or therapy within 21 days of baseline?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 15
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received any other investigational agents within 4 weeks prior to cycle 1, day 1 (or within 5 half-lives of the investigational product, whichever is longer)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 18
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received any other investigational agents within 4 weeks prior to cycle 1, day 1?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 19
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient taken an investigational drug within 28 days or 5 half-lives (minimum 14 days), whichever is shorter, prior to randomization?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 20
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received treatment with any investigational agent within 4 weeks prior to Cycle 1, Day 1, or five drug half-lives (whichever is longer)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 21
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received treatment with any other investigational agent within 4 weeks prior to Cycle 1, Day 1?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 22
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has received prior experimental (non-FDA approved) therapies, the drugs do not share the same target?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 23
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received treatment with any other investigational agent within 4 weeks before initiation of study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 25
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received treatment with any other investigational agent within 4 weeks prior to initiation of study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 24
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient receiving any other investigational agents or has received an investigational agent within the last 30 days?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 26
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received any prior investigational agent for acute myeloid leukemia?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 28
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient currently receiving any other investigational agents within 5 half-lives of the compound or 3 months, whichever is greater?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 27
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient participated in another clinical study with an investigational product during the last 28 days or 5 half-lives prior to study Day 1, whichever is shorter?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received any other investigational agents within 4 weeks or 5 half-lives (whichever is shorter) prior to first dose of the study regimen?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 29
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received any other type of investigational agent within 4 weeks before the first dose of study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 32
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient receiving any other investigational agents or concomitant anti-neoplastic treatment, except endocrine therapies and bisphosphonates which are permitted without restriction even during protocol treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 30
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient participated in another clinical study with an investigational product during the last 30 days or five half-lives of the drug (whichever is less) prior to the initiation of study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 35
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient receiving any other investigational agents or have received them within 14 days prior to enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 34
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received any experimental treatment within 4 weeks prior to study registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 36
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received any investigational agent within 2 weeks as part of a Phase 0 study where a sub-therapeutic dose of drug is administered at the PI's discretion?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 33
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received an investigational drug during the past 28 days or 5 half-lives (whichever is longer) prior to the first dose of study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 37
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient currently receiving or has received any other investigational agent within 14 days prior to initiation of protocol therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 31
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received any other investigational or commercial agents or therapies administered with the intention to treat their leukemia within 14 days or 5 elimination half-lives (whichever is shorter) of first receipt of study drug?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 38
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received treatment with any other investigational agent within 4 weeks prior to Randomization?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 39
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has a prior or concurrent malignancy, the natural history or treatment does not have the potential to interfere with the safety or efficacy assessment of the investigational regimen as assessed by the treating investigator and approved by the Sponsor-Investigator?

DataElement.administrativeNotes: 8/5/2022: fixed the box symbol in AQT_wz
